addition.955: * Note that condition 2 isn't technically accurate under the context of a recursively bounded
addition.956: * type variables. For example, {@code Enum<? extends Enum<E>>} canonicalizes to {@code Enum<?>}
addition.957: * where {@code E} is the type variable declared on the {@code Enum} class declaration. It's
addition.958: * technically not true that {@code Foo>>} is a subtype of {@code
addition.959: * Foo<Enum<?>>} according to JLS. See testRecursiveWildcardSubtypeBug() for a real example.
addition.966: * @param declaration The type variable in the context of a parameterized type. Used to infer type
addition.967: *     bound when {@code formalType} is a wildcard with implicit upper bound.
addition.993: *   <li>{@code canonicalize(t)} always produces the equal result for equivalent types. For
addition.994: *       example both {@code Enum<?>} and {@code Enum<? extends Enum<?>>} canonicalize to {@code
addition.996: *   <li>{@code canonicalize(t)} produces a "literal" supertype of t. For example: {@code Enum<?
addition.997: *       extends Enum<?>>} canonicalizes to {@code Enum<?>}, which is a supertype (if we disregard
addition.998: *       the upper bound is implicitly an Enum too).
addition.1000: *       and vice versa. i.e. {@code A.is(B)} and {@code B.is(A)}.
